newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks end slightly up on settlement day.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks end slightly up on settlement day.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended slightly up on Tuesday mainly on short covering in select blue chips, but overall sentiment was weak in the absence of investor interest on settlement day, dealers said.

"Energy stocks, including PSO, were in demand today, while select blue chips rose on short-covering," dealer Ali Asghar said. "But overall sentiment was weak as investors continued to remain on the sidelines."
The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index rose 3.19 points, or 0.21 percent, to end at 1,530.11. Losers led gainers 174 to 57.
Turnover fell to 40.25 million shares from 40.84 million on Monday.
Hub Power rose 0.45 to 37.35 rupees and PTCL 0.10 to 24.95. Dewan Salman Fibres fell 0.75 to 33.
